trans-unit.source: Compares means from two data sets using a t-test
trans-unit.target: Compares means from two data sets using a t-test

trans-unit.source: You can use the <ui>Hypothesis Testing T-Test</ui> module to generate scores for three types of t-tests:
trans-unit.target: You can use the <ui>Hypothesis Testing T-Test</ui> module to generate scores for three types of t-tests:

trans-unit.source: In general, a t-test helps you compare whether two groups have different means.
trans-unit.target: In general, a t-test helps you compare whether two groups have different means.

trans-unit.source: For example, suppose you are evaluating trial data for patients who received Drug A vs. patients who received Drug B, and you need to compare a recovery rate metric for both groups.
trans-unit.target: For example, suppose you are evaluating trial data for patients who received Drug A vs. patients who received Drug B, and you need to compare a recovery rate metric for both groups.

trans-unit.source: The <newTerm>null hypothesis</newTerm> would assume that the recovery rate is the same in both groups, and furthermore, that the values for the recovery rate have a normal distribution in both two groups.
trans-unit.target: The <newTerm>null hypothesis</newTerm> would assume that the recovery rate is the same in both groups, and furthermore, that the values for the recovery rate have a normal distribution in both two groups.

trans-unit.source: By using <ui>Hypothesis Testing T-Test</ui> and providing the columns that contain the recovery rates as input, you can get scores that indicate whether the difference is meaningful, which would signify that the null hypothesis should be rejected.
trans-unit.target: By using <ui>Hypothesis Testing T-Test</ui> and providing the columns that contain the recovery rates as input, you can get scores that indicate whether the difference is meaningful, which would signify that the null hypothesis should be rejected.

trans-unit.source: The test takes into account factors such as how big the difference is between the values, the size of the sample (larger is better), and how big the standard deviation is (lower is better).
trans-unit.target: The test takes into account factors such as how big the difference is between the values, the size of the sample (larger is better), and how big the standard deviation is (lower is better).

trans-unit.source: <ui>Hypothesis Testing T-Test</ui> indicates whether the null hypothesis is TRUE or FALSE in the right-hand output, and provides the confidence (<math>P</math>) score from the t-test in the left-hand output.
trans-unit.target: <ui>Hypothesis Testing T-Test</ui> indicates whether the null hypothesis is TRUE or FALSE in the right-hand output, and provides the confidence (<math>P</math>) score from the t-test in the left-hand output.

trans-unit.source: Decide which kind of t-test to perform.
trans-unit.target: Decide which kind of t-test to perform.

trans-unit.source: You have a single sample of scores.
trans-unit.target: You have a single sample of scores.

trans-unit.source: All scores are independent from each other.
trans-unit.target: All scores are independent from each other.

trans-unit.source: The sampling distribution of xˉ is normal.
trans-unit.target: The sampling distribution of xˉ is normal.

trans-unit.source: In general, the single sample t-test is used to compare an average value to a known number.
trans-unit.target: In general, the single sample t-test is used to compare an average value to a known number.

trans-unit.source: You have a matched pairs of scores.
trans-unit.target: You have a matched pairs of scores.

trans-unit.source: For example, you might have two different measures per person, or matched pairs of individuals (such as a husband and wife).
trans-unit.target: For example, you might have two different measures per person, or matched pairs of individuals (such as a husband and wife).

trans-unit.source: Each pair of scores is independent of every other pair.
trans-unit.target: Each pair of scores is independent of every other pair.

trans-unit.source: The sampling distribution of dˉ is normal.
trans-unit.target: The sampling distribution of dˉ is normal.

trans-unit.source: A paired t-test is useful when comparing related cases.
trans-unit.target: A paired t-test is useful when comparing related cases.

trans-unit.source: By averaging the differences between the scores of the paired cases, you can determine whether the total difference is statistically significant.
trans-unit.target: By averaging the differences between the scores of the paired cases, you can determine whether the total difference is statistically significant.

trans-unit.source: You have two independent samples of scores.
trans-unit.target: You have two independent samples of scores.

trans-unit.source: That is, there is no basis for pairing scores in sample 1 with those in sample 2.
trans-unit.target: That is, there is no basis for pairing scores in sample 1 with those in sample 2.

trans-unit.source: All scores within a sample are independent of all other scores within that sample.
trans-unit.target: All scores within a sample are independent of all other scores within that sample.

trans-unit.source: The sampling distribution of <math>x</math><subscript>1</subscript> <math>- x</math><subscript>2</subscript> is normal.
trans-unit.target: The sampling distribution of <math>x</math><subscript>1</subscript> <math>- x</math><subscript>2</subscript> is normal.

trans-unit.source: Optionally, satisfy the requirement that the variance among the groups be roughly equal.
trans-unit.target: Optionally, satisfy the requirement that the variance among the groups be roughly equal.

trans-unit.source: Set parameters dictated by the type of data you have and the type of t-test you chose.
trans-unit.target: Set parameters dictated by the type of data you have and the type of t-test you chose.

trans-unit.source: See the <legacyLink xlink:href="#bkmk_Options" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Options</legacyLink> section for more information.
trans-unit.target: See the <legacyLink xlink:href="#bkmk_Options" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Options</legacyLink> section for more information.

trans-unit.source: The output of the module is a dataset containing the t-test scores, and a transformation that you can optionally save to re-apply to this or another dataset using <link xlink:href="805e592d-0f1f-48eb-97c9-688ed0c1dc70" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Apply Transformation</link>.
trans-unit.target: The output of the module is a dataset containing the t-test scores, and a transformation that you can optionally save to re-apply to this or another dataset using <link xlink:href="805e592d-0f1f-48eb-97c9-688ed0c1dc70" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Apply Transformation</link>.

trans-unit.source: No matter which type of t-test you choose, the module outputs two scores:
trans-unit.target: No matter which type of t-test you choose, the module outputs two scores:

trans-unit.source: A probability score that indicates the confidence of the null hypothesis
trans-unit.target: A probability score that indicates the confidence of the null hypothesis

trans-unit.source: A value that indicates whether the Null hypothesis should be rejected
trans-unit.target: A value that indicates whether the Null hypothesis should be rejected

trans-unit.source: The goal is only to determine if we can reject the null hypothesis.
trans-unit.target: The goal is only to determine if we can reject the null hypothesis.

trans-unit.source: Therefore, a score of 0 doesn’t mean we should accept it.
trans-unit.target: Therefore, a score of 0 doesn’t mean we should accept it.

trans-unit.source: It means that we don’t have enough data, and further investigation is needed.
trans-unit.target: It means that we don’t have enough data, and further investigation is needed.

trans-unit.source: The options for configuring the <ui>Hypothesis Testing T-Test</ui> module depend on which type of t-test you apply.
trans-unit.target: The options for configuring the <ui>Hypothesis Testing T-Test</ui> module depend on which type of t-test you apply.

trans-unit.source: Type the value to use as the null-hypothesized mean for the sample.
trans-unit.target: Type the value to use as the null-hypothesized mean for the sample.

trans-unit.target: Use the Column Selector to choose a single numeric column for testing.

trans-unit.source: Choose the type of hypothesis to use when testing.
trans-unit.target: Choose the type of hypothesis to use when testing.

trans-unit.source: The default is a two-tailed test.
trans-unit.target: The default is a two-tailed test.

trans-unit.source: This is the most common type of test, in which the expected distribution is symmetric around zero.
trans-unit.target: This is the most common type of test, in which the expected distribution is symmetric around zero.

trans-unit.source: A one-tailed test provides more power to detect an effect in one direction, by not testing the effect in the other direction.
trans-unit.target: A one-tailed test provides more power to detect an effect in one direction, by not testing the effect in the other direction.

trans-unit.source: A one-tailed test provides more power to detect an effect in one direction, by not testing the effect in the other direction.
trans-unit.target: A one-tailed test provides more power to detect an effect in one direction, by not testing the effect in the other direction.

trans-unit.target: If the value of <math>P</math> (the first output of the module) is lower than the confidence factor, the null hypothesis is rejected.
